title: Elon Musk calls German Christmas market attack 'Deliberate mass murder'; calls Chancellor 'incompetent .. - The Times of India
summary:
Elon Musk calls German Christmas market attack "Deliberate mass murder"; calls Chancellor "incompetent ..."

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Elon Musk has publicly condemned the Christmas market attack in Germany, labeling it as a "deliberate mass murder" and criticizing the German Chancellor for his response.

  • Musk's comments came in the wake of a tragic attack that resulted in multiple casualties.
  • The CEO of Tesla and SpaceX expressed frustration over the handling of security and public safety.
  • This statement adds to Musk's history of engaging with global issues through social media.
"This is not just an act of terror, it’s a failure of leadership to prevent such tragedies." - Elon Musk

This incident underscores ongoing debates about security measures and governmental accountability in times of crisis.
newTitle: Elon Musk Criticizes German Chancellor Over Christmas Market Attack

title: German Christmas market attack: Death toll reaches 5, more than 200 injured - The Times of India
summary:
German Christmas Market Attack: Death Toll Reaches 5, More Than 200 Injured

Publication Date: December 21, 2023

Source: The Times of India

An attack at a German Christmas market has resulted in a tragic loss of life and numerous injuries. A bomb exploded in the heart of the festive celebrations, shaking the community and raising concerns about safety at public events.

  • The attack occurred in a popular Christmas market in Berlin.
  • At least five people have been confirmed dead.
  • More than 200 individuals were reported injured, with several in critical condition.
  • Authorities are investigating the potential motives and identifying the perpetrators.
  • The incident has heightened security measures across festive events in Germany and beyond.
“This is a dark day for our city,” the mayor said in a statement.

The attack has sent shockwaves through Germany, emphasizing the need for vigilance during public gatherings, especially in a season that is meant to promote joy and togetherness.
newTitle: German Christmas Market Attack: Death Toll Reaches 5, Over 200 Injured

title: Watumull: The Indian family that built a business empire in Hawaii from scratch - BBC.com
summary:
Watumull: The Indian family that built a business empire in Hawaii from scratch

Publication Date: Date not specified Source: BBC News

In 1915, Indian entrepreneur Jhamandas Watumull arrived in Hawaii to start a retail shop, which grew to become a significant family business in various sectors, including garment manufacturing and real estate.

  • Jhamandas and his partner Dharamdas started with a single store selling exotic goods.
  • The Watumull family has become one of Hawaii's wealthiest families, deeply integrated into the islands' cultural and economic landscape.
  • They played a pivotal role in popularizing Aloha shirts, which became a significant part of Hawaiian fashion.
  • The family faced challenges, including discrimination and complex immigration laws, before securing US citizenship.
  • Their philanthropy extends to support educational institutions and cultural exchanges between India and Hawaii.
“Slowly, slowly, that's how we did it.” - Jhamandas Watumull

The Watumull family legacy continues to thrive as they shift their focus to real estate while maintaining ties to Hawaii's rich heritage.
newTitle: The Indian Family Behind Hawaii's Business Empire

Big Victory For Turkey’s Hurjet Aircraft; After Malaysian Setback, TAI Wins Maiden Export Order From Spain - EurAsian Times
summary:
Big Victory For Turkey's Hurjet Aircraft; After Malaysian Setback, TAI Wins Maiden Export Order From Spain

Date: December 20, 2023 | Source: Eurasian Times

The Turkish Aerospace Industries (TAI) has secured its first export deal for the Hurjet advanced jet trainer with Spain, following a previous setback with Malaysia. The Hurjet, a single-engine supersonic trainer aircraft, is set to replace Spain's aging fleet of SF-5M trainers.

  • The Spanish Air Force signed a Memorandum of Understanding to procure 24 Hurjet aircraft.
  • The deal follows a failed export attempt to Malaysia, which opted for the Korean T-50.
  • Hurjet can reach speeds of approximately Mach 1.4 and has multiple mission capabilities.
  • Turkey aims to deliver 100 aircraft domestically and 300 to international customers by the 2030s.
“Turkey’s defense exports grew from US$250 million in 2002 to US$5.5 billion in 2023.”

This deal marks a significant step for Turkey's defense industry as it transitions into a global player in aviation technology.
newTitle: Turkey's Hurjet Aircraft Secures First Export Order from Spain After Malaysian Bid

title: Kazan Attack: Massive Fire Erupts As 8 Drones Fly Into Buildings In Russian City, Chilling Videos Surface - News18
summary:
Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: News18

Russia experienced a major attack in its city of Kazan as a series of eight drone strikes targeted high-rise buildings. The strikes reportedly occurred in rapid succession, hitting several multi-story buildings.

  • The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault.
  • Emergency response efforts were launched and residents evacuated from the affected buildings.
  • Kazan airport operations were temporarily suspended due to the attack.
  • Russian air defenses managed to down one drone, but others penetrated defenses.
  • This attack follows a recent drone and missile assault by Russia on Ukrainian cities.
"The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault."

The drone attack on Kazan highlights the ongoing tensions and hostilities between Russia and Ukraine, further escalating the conflict.
newTitle: Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

title: Watch: UK man runs midway through haircut to help policeman under attack, internet says ‘Hero with cape’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
UK Man Becomes Hero Mid-Haircut by Saving Officer from Attack

Publication Date: Dec 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A man in Warrington, Cheshire, interrupted his haircut to heroically assist a police officer being attacked, gaining viral praise for his bravery.

  • Kyle Whiting, 32, abandoned his haircut to help a police officer in distress.
  • He ran across the street, still wearing a barber's cape, to intervene.
  • The incident was captured on video, which quickly went viral on social media.
  • Whiting stated he couldn't just stand by and watch, especially considering his sister is a police officer.
  • After Whiting's intervention, backup arrived, and the attacker was arrested.
  • The story has resonated widely, with many calling him a 'caped crusader' and 'haircut hero.'
“Not all heroes wear capes... but this one does!” - Social media user

This incident highlights how acts of courage can significantly impact critical situations and shows that everyday individuals can be heroes.
newTitle: UK Man Becomes Hero Mid-Haircut by Saving Officer from Attack

title: How first Indians who moved to Hawaii became one of wealthiest families there | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
The Journey of the Watumull Family: From India to Hawaii's Wealthy Elite

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Live Mint

The article explores how Jhamandas Watumull, the son of a brick contractor from Hyderabad, migrated to Hawaii in 1914 and established a thriving retail business that would lead his family to become one of the wealthiest in the region.

  • Jhamandas Watumull opened the 'East India Store' in Honolulu, selling goods from East and South Asia.
  • After facing challenges, the business expanded into a full-line department store and grew significantly over the decades.
  • The family was involved in philanthropic efforts and played a role in introducing Hawaiian-patterned Aloha shirts.
  • Watumull Properties, the family's real estate business, showcases their diversified investments and influence.
“The store was a success but early years were tough.”

This article highlights the resilience and impact of the Watumull family in Hawaii's business landscape and their lasting legacy.
newTitle: The Journey of the Watumull Family: From India to Hawaii's Wealthy Elite

title: Rival protests over South Korea's impeached President Yoon held in Seoul - CNA
summary:
Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Channel News Asia

On December 21, 2024, demonstrators supporting and opposing President Yoon Suk Yeol held rival protests in Seoul, following Yoon's impeachment over his declaration of martial law.

  • Protests were held several hundred meters apart in Gwanghwamun.
  • Tens of thousands of anti-Yoon protesters called for his arrest while expressing concerns over democracy.
  • Several thousand pro-Yoon supporters opposed his removal and supported the restoration of his powers.
  • The National Election Commission denied Yoon's claims regarding election hacking and pro-North Korean sympathizers.
"I wanted to ask Yoon how he could do this to a democracy in the 21st century... he should step down." - Cho Sung-hyo, 27

The protests highlight the deep divisions in South Korean society over the political future of Yoon Suk Yeol, as debates continue about the implications of his martial law declaration.
newTitle: Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol

title: Crude and clout: unpacking the US$13 billion India-Russia oil deal - South China Morning Post
summary:
Crude and Clout: Unpacking the $13 Billion India-Russia Oil Deal

Publication Date: Not specified Source: South China Morning Post

This article explores the significant $13 billion energy deal between India and Russia, highlighting its strategic and pragmatic implications for both nations amidst global geopolitical shifts.

  • The agreement will see Russia supplying nearly 500,000 barrels of crude oil per day to India.
  • Russia now accounts for over 40% of India’s oil imports, a significant rise from less than 2% before the Ukraine invasion.
  • The deal is seen as a lifeline for Russia amidst economic isolation due to Western sanctions.
“Western sanctions... have forced Moscow to sell crude at a discount of US$3 to US$4 per barrel compared to global benchmarks.”

This oil deal represents not just a transaction, but a strategic partnership bolstered by geopolitical necessities amid shifting global alliances.
newTitle: Crude and Clout: Unpacking the $13 Billion India-Russia Oil Deal

title: US government shutdown averted as funding bill clears Senate - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Government Shutdown Averted as Funding Bill Clears Senate

Date: Dec 21, 2024 11:48 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The United States government managed to avoid a shutdown as the Senate worked through the night to ensure the passage of a bipartisan funding bill to manage federal operations temporarily.

  • The House of Representatives approved the bill by a margin of 366-34 before it went to the Senate.
  • The Senate voted 85-11 in favor of the bill, averting a shutdown.
  • The funding package will last until March 14 and includes $100 billion in disaster aid and $10 billion in agricultural assistance.
  • Outgoing President Joe Biden is expected to sign the legislation into law.
“This is a good time for the country,” said Speaker Mike Johnson after the House vote.

This legislative action has made sure that the essential services of the government continue without interruption.
newTitle: US Government Shutdown Averted as Funding Bill Clears Senate

Colombian lawmaker Cathy Juvinao apologised after being caught vaping during a parliamentary session on healthcare reforms.

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

A Colombian lawmaker, Cathy Juvinao, was caught on camera vaping during a parliamentary meeting on healthcare reforms. The incident sparked widespread criticism and outrage.

  • Juvinao, representing Bogotá and a member of the Green Alliance Party, was seen using a vape pen during a December 17 session.
  • The meeting focused on discussing changes to Colombia's health policies.
  • After the incident went viral, Juvinao apologised on social media, acknowledging her lapse in judgement.
  • Recently, Colombia passed a law regulating the use of electronic cigarettes and vaping devices.
“I will not join the bad example that is intoxicating the public discourse these days and which will not be repeated.”

Smoking and vaping are prohibited in government buildings in Colombia, including parliamentary chambers.

title: Tel Aviv hit by projectile fired from Yemen, say Israeli officials - CNN International
Elon Musk emerges as power player amid US government shutdown crisis - Hindustan Times
summary:
Elon Musk emerges as power player amid US government shutdown crisis

Published: December 21, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

In the midst of the US shutdown crisis, Elon Musk emerged as a significant influencer, wielding considerable power alongside President-elect Donald Trump. The world's richest person played a key role as the Republican-controlled US House of Representatives passed legislation on Friday that would avert a midnight government shutdown.

  • The House passed a bipartisan bill by a vote of 366-34 to avoid a government shutdown.
  • Trump and Musk actively opposed a prior bipartisan funding plan due to controversial provisions.
  • Musk used social media to influence public opinion and shape policy discussions around the funding bill.
  • The final package stripped many controversial provisions and would fund the government through March.
  • Musk's role suggests increasing influence in Washington, particularly as head of the Department of Government Efficiency in Trump's administration.
"It went from a bill that weighed pounds to a bill that weighed ounces," Musk wrote on X, signaling his approval of the revised bill.

The government shutdown crisis was narrowly averted, but the power struggle between the White House, Congress, and Musk's influence continues.
newTitle: Elon Musk's Influential Role in Preventing Government Shutdown

title: In open letter, Jagmeet Singh says NDP will vote to topple Trudeaus govt in Canada - The Tribune India
Rocket fired from Yemen strikes an area of Tel Aviv overnight; 16 people lightly injured - The Hindu
summary:
Rocket Fired from Yemen Strikes Tel Aviv, Injuring 16

Date: December 21, 2024
Source: Reuters

A rocket launched from Yemen struck Tel Aviv, injuring 16 people from shattered glass, while others were hurt rushing for cover.

  • 16 individuals were slightly injured due to flying glass from windows.
  • 14 additional people suffered minor injuries while seeking shelter.
  • The incident occurred just before 4 a.m. local time.
  • This attack follows recent Israeli airstrikes on Houthi positions in Yemen.
  • The Iranian-backed Houthis have launched over 200 missiles during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
  • Israeli attacks on ports in Yemen have significantly impacted food shipment capacities.
U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres warned both sides' attacks risk further escalation in the region.

This incident highlights the escalating tensions in the region and the potential for wider conflict, affecting both Yemeni capabilities and Israeli security.
newTitle: Rocket Fired from Yemen Strikes Tel Aviv, Injuring 16
